WRITING.TITLE: My French teacher was the worst teacher i #8217;ve ever had
WRITING.TEXT: (This is a long story )( and im not sure if this counts as a personal attack against my french teacher since personal attacks are against the rules ) First year of high school (12-13years old, i live in the netherlands so we have a different school system) we had a lot of french teachers , one was really nice , one was not mean but kinda bad at teaching and one was just a jackass, atleast thats how i saw him. i have dyslexia so i have a lot of trouble with other languages that aren #8217;t English or dutch. So why i didn #8217;t like him that year was because he gave me and half of the class detention because we had a bad grade, which isnt why i was so mad, all he did was just telling us we didnt study (while most of us did! i know those kids and we really tried but just have a lot of trouble with it) and he was just laughing at us! If he would have just talked to us and asked if we didnt study or if we just had trouble with it and give us tips on how to study i wouldn #8217;t have been so mad. So i really didn #8217;t like him, the year after we had this woman and she was really nice . (So i have a lot of mental issues now/in highschool and he only made it worse which i will explain in the this part) So in the third year(14-15 year old) we had him again. I was still mad at him and didn #8217;t believe he would have chanced in just 1 or 2 years. I was right. He was awful, he put a lot of pressure on us, we would have to learn a lot of words and if you even got as much as 2 wrong you got detention and would have to write all words 40 times with translation. This made a lot of us stress out. I was still scared if i failed a test i would get detention and he would just laugh at me again. So after the first french lesson of that year i already came home stressed out, this went on for weeks and my stress turned into anxiety. I cried the most days before french just looking at list of words we had to learn and just cry for 2 hours cuz i couldn #8217;t remember them and i was so stressed out and anxious. Everytime after french class i ran to the bathrooms to cry and then went to the frontdesk to ask if i could go home for the day cuz i didnt feel well. So i started to feel really depressed again and had anxiety attacks because of his classes so i decided to go back to therapy. Something the french teacher said a lot was: #8221; the stress you have is your own fault #8220; he didn #8217;t say this to me personally but to the whole class, this did piss me off cuz i have mental disorders that mostly caused my stress and he made me feel like its my fault. Other stuff he said was #8220; making fun of each other and laughing at each other is not allowed #8221; which i thought was a bit hypocritical seeing how he laughed at us last year And he said if you had detention to write those words 40 times that #8220;i will be greeting you with a smile #8221; My thought at that moment was #8221; dont you mean laughing at us? #8221; And something else he said was #8220; and we would still be friends #8220; and i was like #8220; thats a one sided friendship then #8221; i was still really mad at him I talked to someone higher up about his methods of teaching how much this stressed out the students and that teacher talked to the french teacher and he didn #8217;t do the detention thing anymore which helped a little bit but i still feel anxious in his classes . We had test week and with the french test i had a panic attack and started hyperventilating, so i had to leave the classroom, i failed the test with a 1,2 and i didnt even want to retake the test I told this to a friend who is in a different class and they said they had the same thing. They also always cried after french and got a lot of detention from that guy just for having trouble with french . I used to love french music but now i feel lowkey anxious everytime i hear french, i guess it really effected me .
